english_translation: Narrated from Mujahid regarding Allah's saying: 'They ask you about fighting in the sacred month' - meaning that a man from Bani Tamim was sent by the Messenger of Allah ﷺ in a military expedition, and he met Ibn al-Hadramī carrying wine from Ta'if to Makkah, and shot him with an arrow and killed him. This occurred on the last day of Jumada al-Thani and the first day of Rajab. There was a covenant between the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and Quraysh, so Quraysh said: Did you kill in the sacred month while we have a covenant? Allah revealed: 'They ask you about fighting in the sacred month. Say: Fighting in it is great' - meaning all of this is greater than the killing of Ibn al-Hadramī. Then He said: 'And the persecution' - meaning disbelief in Allah and the worship of idols is greater than all of this.

english_translation: Narrated from Abu Malik: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ sent Abdullah ibn Jahsh and some Muslims against the polytheists, and they met them at Nakhlah valley. The Muslims thought it was the last day of Jumada, and it was the first day of Rajab, so they killed Amr ibn al-Hadramī. The polytheists said to them: Did you not claim that you hold the sacred month sacred? Yet you killed in it! So Allah revealed: 'They ask you about fighting in the sacred month. Say: Fighting in it is great' - meaning all of this is greater before Allah than what you objected to. And 'the persecution' - which you are established upon, meaning shirk - is greater than killing.

english_translation: Narrated from Mujahid regarding Allah's saying: 'They ask you about wine and gambling. Say: In them is great sin' - This was the first censure of wine. 'And benefits for the people' means what they gain from gambling. Gambling is al-Maysir, and it was called Maysir because they said 'Aysiru' meaning 'lighten' or 'cut', like when one says 'Place such and such.'
